item.description:
Discover two outdoor gems with North Quabbin Trails Assoc. president Bobby Curley and ABNC guide Allen Young, author of North of Quabbin Revisited.

The group will meet at the Center and proceed by shuttle bus to Skyfields Arboretum, the headquarters of Mount Grace Land Conservation Trust, for a walkabout of the arboretum and information about Mount Grace.

Then the group will head on to S. Royalston and the brand new P+P loop trail, a short, easy walk(1/2 mile according to Bob Curley) along the just-developed eight-mile Millers/Baquaq River trail, before returning to the Center.

This event is cosponsored by ABNC, NQTA, MGLCT, Americorps and the Athol Council on Aging.


Email from Bob Curley regarding this event and line up: NQTA is proudly, in co-sponsership with Athol Bird and Nature Club, leading a Autumn Naturalist Walk at two of N.Quabbin Region Areas true botanist and nature spots.

In partnership with Mnt Grace Land Trust / Americorp , Council for Aging , AARP , Garden Club and invaluable assistance from CTS. We will start our adventure. @ MREC (millers river environmental center ) @ 9 o'clock . We will then proceed by shuttle bus to Mnt Grace headquarters / Skyfield Arboretum where we will be led on a Walkabout of the amazing Arboretum by Tom , Mount Grace biologist with valuable input from Athol Bird Club personnel.

Then a short bio by Leigh Youngblood on the history and projects that make Mnt Grace Conservation Land Trust such an important fabric of our region. Lite refreshments will be served.

Then back to the buses and of to the brand new P+P loop trail a short naturalist walk along the just developed 8 mile Millers / Baquag River Trail. This loop trail is being developed as a limited mobility access trail and offers a wonderous blue heron fishing pool , a walk along the river and thru a beautiful old growth hemlock stand and large vernal pool

For you that know me we will be doing something different and be going at a very moderate pace to take advantage of the vast knowledge of our surroundings by our nature club friends. ( promise ) This is shaping up to be a great event to celebrate the coming of Autumn and the joining of our outdoor organizations.

We need a head count for shuttle service so your response would be appreciated. The timing of event is 9 o'clock MREC , Leaving Mnt Grace 10:30, Leaving P+P loop trail (s.royalston) 12:30 Back at MREC 1:00 This event is open and free of charge so all outdoor peeps come join us for a day of fun and education. Happy Trails Bobby Curley Pres. NQTA
item.how_to_find_us: Parking is in the rear of the building. There is also roadside parking available on Main Street.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Autumn Naturalist Walk(Not a Regular Hike)
